title: Oil giant BP quietly steps out of the takeover spotlight
summary: Takeover speculation regarding British energy major BP appears to have dried up, with shares of the company up more than 32% since early April.

title: Giant Oil Trader Begins Physical Trading In Uranium
summary: Giant oil and gas trader Mercuria reportedly has begun physical trading in uranium, becoming the first major commodity company to do so, according to Reuters. title: Shale oil execs say Trump policies are hurting investment, 'business is broken'
summary: The executives' anonymous comments were published in a quarterly survey of oil and gas companies by the Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas this week.

title: Beijing Finds New Workarounds for Iranian Oil
summary: China has logged a sharp increase in crude imports from Indonesia in recent months, suggesting Beijing has found "new workarounds" to access Iranian oil despite U.S. sanctions, Bloomberg reports. title: Iraq Expects Kurdistan Oil Exports to Restart This Week
summary: Iraq expects crude oil exports from the semi-autonomous region of Kurdistan via pipeline to Turkey to resume this week, Iraqi Foreign Minister Fuad Hussein has told Bloomberg in an interview. Oil exports from Kurdistan have been halted for two and a half years, after they were shut in in March 2023…

title: US oil executives bemoan ‘twilight of shale’
summary: Respondents to Dallas Fed survey stepped up their criticism of Donald Trump’s policies

title: France’s Total cuts buybacks in fresh sign of oil price pressures
summary: Energy investors brace for reduction in returns as lower crude prices take toll
